availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan L. Price (Rockcastle County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Isaiah Price and Lucretia Price. Married to Hannah Broughton Price in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, on August 12, 1856. Father of Martha F. Price and Steven B. Price. Resident of Rockcastle County in 1850. Farmer in Rockcastle County in 1860. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861, to April 27, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 161B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 525.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053, Rockcastle County Marriages, p. 7.
“Price, Johnathan L.,” Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 370.
